Instructions: 

- Set up the GitHub Desktop program on your computer.
- Link your GitHub account.  You can find the login option in the **File** menu.  The login option should look like:


```{r echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
expandable_html_image("github_desktop_sign_in.PNG", moodle_quiz = TRUE, bg_alpha = 0.1, img_width = 70)
```


- Take a screenshot after you have signed in.


<div class="blackborder">
GitHub desktop running on my computer looks like this:


```{r echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
# expandable_html_image("github_desktop_signed_in.PNG",  moodle_quiz = TRUE, bg_alpha = 0.1, img_width = 70)
expandable_html_image("github_desktop_signed_in.PNG",  moodle_quiz = TRUE, bg_alpha = 0.1, img_width = 70)
expandable_html_image("github_desktop_signed_in.PNG",  moodle_quiz = FALSE, bg_alpha = 0.1, img_width = 70)
```

<br><br><br>

- Note that if you haven't used GitHub before, you won't have a repository list.
